item.text: Now with regard to the issues you wrote about: “It is good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.”

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="1223">because of</st> <st data-num="4202" class="">immoralities</st>, <st data-num="1538" class="">each man</st> should <st data-num="2192" class="">have relations with</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2398" class="">his own</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1538" class="">each woman</st> with<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2398" class="">her own</st> <st data-num="435" class="">husband</st>.

A <st data-num="435" class="">husband</st> should <st data-num="591" class="">fulfill</st> his <st data-num="03782" class="">marital responsibility</st><n id="1" /> to his <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st>, and <st data-num="3668" class="">likewise</st> a <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> to her <st data-num="435" class="">husband</st>.

It is <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> the <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> who <st data-num="1850" class="">has</st> the <st data-num="1850" class="">rights</st> to <st data-num="2398" class="">her own</st> <st data-num="4983" class="">body</st>, <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> the <st data-num="435" class="">husband</st>. <st data-num="3668">In the same way</st>, it is <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> the <st data-num="435" class="">husband</st> who <st data-num="1850" class="">has</st> the <st data-num="1850" class="">rights</st> to <st data-num="2398">his own</st> <st data-num="4983" class="">body</st>, <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> the <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st>.

Do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="650" class="">deprive</st> <st data-num="240">each other</st>, <st data-num="1487 3385">except</st> <st data-num="1537">by</st> <st data-num="4859">mutual agreement</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">for</st> a <st data-num="2540">specified time</st>, <st data-num="2443" class="">so that</st> you may <st data-num="4980" class="">devote</st> yourselves to <st data-num="4335" class="">prayer</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="3825">resume</st> your relationship,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2443">so that</st> <st data-num="4567" class="">Satan</st> may <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3985" class="">tempt</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">because of</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="192">lack of self-control</st>.

I <st data-num="3004" class="">say</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">as</st> a <st data-num="4774" class="">concession</st>, <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">as</st> a <st data-num="2003" class="">command</st>.
I wish that everyone was as I am. But each has his own gift from God, one this way, another that.
To the unmarried and widows I say that it is best for them to remain as I am.
But if they do not have self-control, let them get married. For it is better to marry than to burn with sexual desire.
To the married I give this command—not I, but the Lord—a wife should not divorce a husband
(but if she does, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband), and a husband should not divorce his wife.
To the rest I say—I, not the Lord—if a brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is happy to live with him, he should not divorce her.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> <st data-num="1487">if</st> a <st data-num="1135" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="2192" class="">has</st> a <st data-num="435" class="">husband</st> who is <st data-num="571">not a believer</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3778">he</st> is <st data-num="4909">happy</st> to <st data-num="3611">live</st> <st data-num="3326" class="">with</st> <st data-num="846" class="">her</st>, she should <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="863" class="">divorce</st> <st data-num="435" class="">him</st>.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> the <st data-num="571" class="">unbelieving</st> <st data-num="435">husband</st> is <st data-num="37" class="">sanctified</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">because of</st> the <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st>, <st data-num="2532">and</st> the <st data-num="571" class="">unbelieving</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> <st data-num="1722">because of</st> her <st data-num="80" class="">husband</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1893 686">Otherwise</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="5043" class="">children</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">are</st> <st data-num="169" class="">unclean</st>, <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="3568" class="">now</st> they <st data-num="1510" class="">are</st> <st data-num="40" class="">holy</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> the <st data-num="571" class="">unbeliever</st> <st data-num="5563" class="">wants a divorce</st>, let it <st data-num="5563">take place</st>. <st data-num="1722" class="">In</st> <st data-num="5108">these circumstances</st> the <st data-num="80" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="79" class="">sister</st> is <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1402" class="">bound</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> has <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="1515" class="">peace</st>.
For how do you know, wife, whether you will bring your husband to salvation? Or how do you know, husband, whether you will bring your wife to salvation?
Nevertheless, as the Lord has assigned to each one, as God has called each person, so must he live. I give this sort of direction in all the churches.

Was <st data-num="5100" class="">anyone</st> <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> after he had been <st data-num="4059" class="">circumcised</st>? He should <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> try to <st data-num="1986">undo</st> his <st data-num="1986">circumcision</st>.<n id="1" /> Was <st data-num="5100" class="">anyone</st> <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> who is <st data-num="203" class="">uncircumcised</st>? He should <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="4059">get circumcised</st>.

<st data-num="4061" class="">Circumcision</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3762" class="">nothing</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="203" class="">uncircumcision</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3762" class="">nothing</st>. <st data-num="235" class="">Instead</st>, <st data-num="5084" class="">keeping</st> <st data-num="2316">God’s</st> <st data-num="1785" class="">commandments</st> is what counts.

Let <st data-num="1538">each one</st> <st data-num="3306" class="">remain</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="3778">that</st> <st data-num="2821">situation in life</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">which</st> he was <st data-num="2564">called</st>.

Were you <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> as a <st data-num="1401" class="">slave</st>?<n id="1" /> Do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3199" class="">worry</st> about it. <st data-num="235" class="">But</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> <st data-num="2532">indeed</st> you are <st data-num="1410" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="1096" class="">be</st> <st data-num="1658" class="">free</st>, <st data-num="5530" class="">make</st> the <st data-num="3123" class="">most</st> of the <st data-num="5530" class="">opportunity</st>.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> the one who was <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st> as a <st data-num="1401" class="">slave</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> the <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord’s</st> <st data-num="558" class="">freedman</st>. <st data-num="3668">In the same way</st>, the one who was <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st> as a <st data-num="1658">free person</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="5547">Christ’s</st> <st data-num="1401" class="">slave</st>.

You were <st data-num="59" class="">bought</st> with a <st data-num="5092" class="">price</st>. Do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1096" class="">become</st> <st data-num="1401" class="">slaves</st> of <st data-num="444" class="">men</st>.
In whatever situation someone was called, brothers and sisters, let him remain in it with God.
With regard to the question about people who have never married, I have no command from the Lord, but I give my opinion as one shown mercy by the Lord to be trustworthy.

<st data-num="1223" class="">Because of</st> the <st data-num="1764" class="">impending</st> <st data-num="1764" class="">crisis</st> I <st data-num="3543" class="">think</st> it <st data-num="2570" class="">best</st> for you to <st data-num="5225" class="">remain</st> as you <st data-num="1510">are</st>.

The one <st data-num="1210" class="">bound</st> to a <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> should <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2212" class="">seek</st> <st data-num="3080" class="">divorce</st>. The one <st data-num="3089" class="">released</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> a <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> should <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2212" class="">seek</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">marriage</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="1437" class="">if</st> you <st data-num="1060" class="">marry</st>, you have <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="264" class="">sinned</st>. <st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> <st data-num="1437" class="">if</st> a <st data-num="3933" class="">virgin</st> <st data-num="1060" class="">marries</st>, she has <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="264" class="">sinned</st>. <st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="5108">those who marry</st> will <st data-num="2192" class="">face</st> <st data-num="2347">difficult circumstances</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> am trying to <st data-num="5339" class="">spare</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> such problems.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">And</st> I <st data-num="5346" class="">say</st> <st data-num="3778">this</st>, <st data-num="80">brothers and sisters</st>:<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="2540" class="">time</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="4958" class="">short</st>. <st data-num="2443">So then</st> those who <st data-num="2192" class="">have</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">wives</st> should <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">as</st> those who <st data-num="2192" class="">have</st> <st data-num="3361" class="">none</st>,

those <st data-num="2799">with tears</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">like</st> those <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2799" class="">weeping</st>, those who <st data-num="5463" class="">rejoice</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">like</st> those <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="5463" class="">rejoicing</st>, those who <st data-num="59" class="">buy</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">like</st> those <st data-num="3361" class="">without</st> <st data-num="2722" class="">possessions</st>,
those who use the world as though they were not using it to the full. For the present shape of this world is passing away.
And I want you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the things of the Lord, how to please the Lord.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> a <st data-num="1060">married man</st> is <st data-num="3309" class="">concerned</st> about t<st data-num="3588">he things</st> of the <st data-num="2889" class="">world</st>, <st data-num="4459" class="">how</st> to <st data-num="700" class="">please</st> his <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st>,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> he is <st data-num="3307" class="">divided</st>. An <st data-num="22" class="">unmarried</st> <st data-num="1135">woman</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">or</st> a <st data-num="3933" class="">virgin</st><n id="2" /> is <st data-num="3309" class="">concerned</st> about <st data-num="3588" class="">the things</st> of the <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st>, <st data-num="2443">to</st> <st data-num="1510">be</st> <st data-num="40" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">both</st> in <st data-num="4983" class="">body</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4151" class="">spirit</st>. <st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> a <st data-num="1060">married woman</st> is <st data-num="3309" class="">concerned</st> about <st data-num="3588" class="">the things</st> of <st data-num="3588" class="">the</st> <st data-num="2889" class="">world</st>, <st data-num="4459" class="">how</st> to <st data-num="700" class="">please</st> her <st data-num="435" class="">husband</st>.
I am saying this for your benefit, not to place a limitation on you, but so that without distraction you may give notable and constant service to the Lord.
If anyone thinks he is acting inappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the bloom of youth and it seems necessary, he should do what he wishes; he does not sin. Let them marry.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">the man who</st> <st data-num="2476" class="">is</st> <st data-num="1476" class="">firm</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="846">his</st> <st data-num="2588" class="">commitment</st>, and is <st data-num="2192" class="">under</st> <st data-num="3361" class="">no</st> <st data-num="318" class="">necessity</st> <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2192" class="">has</st> <st data-num="1849">control</st> <st data-num="4012" class="">over</st> <st data-num="2398" class="">his</st> <st data-num="2307" class="">will</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> has <st data-num="2919" class="">decided</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="2398" class="">his own</st> <st data-num="2588" class="">mind</st> to <st data-num="5083" class="">keep</st> <st data-num="1438" class="">his own</st> <st data-num="3933" class="">virgin</st>, <st data-num="4160" class="">does</st> <st data-num="2573" class="">well</st>.
So then, the one who marries his own virgin does well, but the one who does not, does better.
A wife is bound as long as her husband is living. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes (only someone in the Lord).
But in my opinion, she will be happier if she remains as she is—and I think that I too have the Spirit of God!
